alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 3:30AM AKST until February 16 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and low wind chills expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Wind chills to 55 below. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous wind chills will develop late this this morning as winds increase. Winds will continue to increase this afternoon causing wind chill values to continue to drop and visibility to drop to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
